questionTitle: The center of gravity of the human body ___ behind the hip joint.
___millions of galaxies exist in the vast space outside the Milky Way.
If more than five thousand dollars in monetary instruments is transported into the United States, a report needs ________ with the customs office.
John F.Kennedy was the youngest president of the United States and ________ to be assassinated.
John has not been able to recall where ________.
The families were told to evacuate their houses immediately ________.
anwers: at the time when the water began to go up to
when the water began to rise
when up was going the water
in the time when the water raised

questionTitle: Within an area of only 100 miles, Death Valley sinks to 282 feet below sea level while Mount Whitney ________ to a height of 14,494 feet.
Isaac Newton, ________, made his discoveries about gravity nearly 300 years ago.
anwers: he was an English scientist and philosopher
being an English scientist and philosopher
was an English scientist and philosopher

questionTitle: Before Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin, many people died ________.
________ through a telescope, Venus appears to go through changes in size and shape.
________ the formation of the Sun, the planets, and other stars began with the condensation of an interstellar cloud.
That most natural time units are not simple multiples of each other ________ in constructing a calendar.
By the time a baby has reached his first birthday, he should, without the help of an adult, ________ sit up or even stand up.
________ the plough is being displaced by new techniques that protect the land and promise more abundant crops.
Young rivers have no flood plains and their valleys are ________ .
The geographic position of North America, ________ in the early days of the European settlement.
anwers: laying between the Atlantic and the Pacific Oceans, isolating it
isolating it as it laid between the Atlantic and the Pacific Oceans
lying between the Atlantic and the Pacific Oceans, isolated it
isolating it between the Atlantic and the Pacific Oceans as it was layed

questionTitle: Football teams don't play in the Super Bowl championship ________ either the National or the American Conference.
The foreign policies ________ the Hoover administration undertook in 1929 were marked by good will and peaceful purpose.
One of the most influential Virginians of colonial times, ________ in England.
anwers: the education received by William Bird
was the education that William Bird received
the education that William Bird received

questionTitle: It was not until she had arrived home ________ remembered her appointment with the doctor.
